text: The next time frame participant we're going to talk about is the short-term traders.
Short-term traders tend to hold trades for longer than a day, sometimes even up to three
Short-term traders give more attention to the technicals and fundamental factors.
Just like the day trader who focuses on technicals, the short-term trader includes
Short-term traders have a tendency to buy low and sell high looking for momentum breaks
Short-term traders accept and interpret fundamentals whilst using market generated information.
The key major difference between a day trader and a short-term trader, as we can see in
the example provided, is that, as we said in the previous slide, a day trader will
Once or if that re-enters the previous day's range, the day trader will have a tendency
to exit that trade and flatten its risk.
A swing or short-term trader, however, would be more willing to hold onto that trade with
a slightly bigger risk in the hope of slightly bigger profits.
